channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-6093] table creation should fail when user does not have permissions on db
item.description:
Its possible to create a table under a database where the user does not have write permission. It can be done by specifying a LOCATION where the user has write access (say /tmp/foo). This should be restricted.

HdfsAuthorizationProvider (which typically runs on client) checks the database directory during table creation. But StorageBasedAuthorizationProvider does not.
item.summary: table creation should fail when user does not have permissions on db

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Attaching a first approach patch. This checks the permission of database directory even if a location was specified during table creation.
Updated patch for trunk and also added unit tests. Unit tests TestMetastoreAuthorizationProvider and TestStorageBasedMetastoreAuthorizationProvider passed. Running complete suite.
Attaching file in a format compatible with pre-commit test . (https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/Hive+PreCommit+Patch+Testing)

ATTACHMENT ID: 12662185
Patch committed to trunk. Thanks for the contribution Thiruvel!
Does this need user documentation, or is it just considered a bug fix? (In other words, would documentation bring unwanted attention to the previous behavior?)
This is considered a bug fix. I don't think we need additional documentation for it.
This has been fixed in 0.14 release. Please open new jira if you see any issues.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: One cannot create table (whether or not they provide a LOCATION) if they do not have WRITE permission on the database directory.
